_header: That knot that is knit should not be broken
_description: A moral couplet on marriage — one couplet

BodLauMis77.Transcription:
þat knotte þat is knytte scholde not be brokeneTrw loue in
                    hertus to-gydur scholde be lokene
BodLauMis77.Editions:
Wenzel,  Siegfried. 
             “Unrecorded Middle-English Verses.” 
             Anglia
         92 (1974): 55-78: 70.
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “Poems Dealing with Contemporary Conditions.” 
             A Manual of the Writings in Middle English.
            Albert E. Hartung, ed. 
         Vol. 5, fascicle 13. New Haven, CT: Connecticut Academy of Arts and
            Sciences, 1975: 1385-1536, 1631-1725: 1454.
